DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Specimen Tissue Collection Area Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a text field to describe the region or surface from which sample of tissue (cells with similar or specialized characteristics) from the prostate gland (male reproductive organ) is taken for research.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the region or surface from which a sample of tissue (aggregate of cells with similar or specialized characteristics) from the prostate gland (male reproductive organ) is taken for research.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.:The act of gathering something together.:Area; the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Area; the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to specified characteristics of a specimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
